titleStmt.title: A short treatise of the great worth and best kind of nobility Wherein, that of nature is highly commended, that of grace is justly preferred; the one from humane experience, the other upon divine evidence. / By Henry Whiston, rector of Balcomb in Sussex.
titleStmt.author: Whiston, Henry.
Pearson, John, 1613-1686.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by E. Cotes for William Palmer at the Palm-tree in Fleetstreet,

notesStmt.note: The first leaf bears a note "To the author" signed: John Pearson.
Running title reads: The great worth, and best kinde of nobility.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
